item.title: Help Protect Your Family from Lung Cancer: Test and Know Your Home’s Radon Level
item.description: ATLANTA – January is National Radon Action Month and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) along with state, tribal and local public health agencies to encourage all Americans to test their homes for radon.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: An EPA Enforcement Settlement with McWane Helps Improve Water Quality and the Quality of Life for the Residents of Birmingham
item.description: Atlanta - Greenwood Park, located along Village Creek in Birmingham, Alabama illustrates how a green solution can positively improve stormwater management concerns while enhancing the beauty and economic vitality to the neighborhoods of North Birmingham.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Hosts National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week in Memphis
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Region 4 announces its activities for National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week. National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week will be observed October 23-29, 2016.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Settles with Syngenta Crop Protection, LLC for alleged Multi-Regional Violations of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA)
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today announced a multi-region settlement with Syngenta Crop Protection, LLC (Syngenta) in Greensboro, N.C., for alleged violations of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA and DOT Finalize Greenhouse Gas and Fuel Efficiency Standards for Heavy-Duty Trucks
item.description: ATLANTA – Today the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Report Tracks our Changing Climate
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today released a report that shows compelling and clear evidence of long-term changes to our climate, and highlights impacts on human health and the environment in the United States and around the world.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Issues Final Actions to Cut Methane Emissions from Municipal Solid Waste Landfills
item.description: ATLANTA – Continuing the Obama Administration’s commitment to taking action on climate change and protecting public health, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is taking steps to further reduce emissions of methane-rich gas from municipal solid waste (MSW) landfills.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Announces $100,000 in Supplemental Funds to Clean up a Contaminated Brownfield Site in Palm Beach County, FL
item.description: Atlanta – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced Palm Beach County, FL as an awardee of $100,000 in petroleum supplemental funding for the Old Boynton Beach High School brownfield project.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Announces $400,000 in Supplemental Funds to Clean up Contaminated Brownfield Sites in Chattanooga, TN
item.description: Atlanta – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced the City of Chattanooga, TN as an awardee of $400,000 in hazardous supplemental funding for two brownfield projects.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Extends Application Deadline for Next Class of the Environmental Justice Academy
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Region 4 has extended the application deadline for the second class of the Environmental Justice (EJ) Academy. Applications are now due by June 30, 2016.
item.dc:creator: Region 04
